meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Estimate Rises on Gold Taken From Nazis' Victims A Swiss study said the amount of gold stolen from the Nazis' victims was much higher than had been assumed, which is likely to strengthen claims for restitution. Page A6.

Estimate Rises on Gold Taken From Nazis' Victims A Swiss study said the amount of gold stolen from the Nazis' victims was much higher than had been assumed, which is likely to strengthen claims for restitution. Page A6.
Dow Rises Above 8,000 Stock markets around the world rallied, bolstered in part by a sense that Japanese and Southeast Asian officials were moving to address their financial problems. Page D1.
Tough Task on Climate As the conference on global warming opened in Japan with many hard issues unresolved, the United States decided to send Vice President Al Gore to argue its position. Page A10.
World AIDS Day Observed With memories of those killed by AIDS and hopes that the young can avoid it, the day was observed in ways big and small. Page A26.
Stephane Grappelli Dies The witty and urbane jazz violinist, best known for his role in founding the Quintet of the Hot Club of France, was 89. Page B7.
